intro: Asarina filipes, commonly known as the slender asarina, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. The botanical features of Asarina filipes make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
